title: 3 Easy Ways to Convert PDF to MOBI

steps.title: Install Calibre on your computer.
steps.content: Install Calibre on your computer. Calibre is a free e-book management app that can convert various file formats. If you don't have Calibre installed, visit https://calibre-ebook.com/download to download the correct version for your operating system.

steps.title: Open Calibri.
steps.content: Open Calibri. You'll find it in your Start menu if you're using Windows. Mac users can find it in the Applications folder. If you installed Calibre on Linux, you can convert the file at the command prompt using the command ebook-convert test.pdf output.mobi . Replace "test.pdf" with the full name of the PDF file and "output.mobi" with the desired output file name.

steps.title: Click Add Books.
steps.content: Click Add Books . It's the green book with a plus + symbol at the app's top-left corner.

steps.title: Select the PDF and click Open.
steps.content: Select the PDF and click Open . This imports the PDF file into Calibre.

steps.title: Select the PDF and click Convert Books.
steps.content: Select the PDF and click Convert Books . It's the brown book icon with two curved arrows inside, and you'll find it at the top of Calibre. This opens the "Convert" window.

steps.title: Select MOBI from the "Output format" menu.
steps.content: Select MOBI from the "Output format" menu. It's at the top-right corner of the "Convert" window.

steps.title: Select your conversion preferences in the left panel.
steps.content: Select your conversion preferences in the left panel. Since some PDF files contain proprietary formatting features, the MOBI file may look slightly different than the PDF. The options on the left side of the screen allow you to specify elements of the final file. [1] X Research source The Metadata tab allows you to change the way the title, cover, author, and other descriptive info appears in the converted file. The Look & Feel tab lets you customize colors, text, and layout. MOBI output has format-specific options for ignoring margins, avoiding JPEG image conversion, disabling compression, and changing the MOBI version. By default, "MOBI file type" is set to "old" to ensure compatibility with all Kindles. However, if you have a newer Kindle (3rd generation or later, except Kindle DX), changing to New adds additional formatting features. The Heuristic Processing section is here in case you wind up with missing words or extra spaces in your MOBI file after converting. Since this option could mess up an otherwise fine PDF-to-MOBI conversion, don't select it at first. If the converted file has spacing issues, try converting again with this option selected.

steps.title: Click OK to convert the file.
steps.content: Click OK to convert the file. It's at the bottom-right corner of the window. The PDF will now convert to the MOBI format.

steps.title: Click Save to disk to save the file to the desired location.
steps.content: Click Save to disk to save the file to the desired location. It's the blue disk icon in the toolbar that runs along the top of Calibre. You can now select a location on your hard drive to save the converted file. Once the file is saved, you can move it to your favorite e-reader or e-reading software. If you donâ€™t see Save to disk , expand the window to see the entire toolbar.

steps.title: Log in to Amazon.com.
steps.content: Log in to Amazon.com. If your goal is to convert a PDF to MOBI so you can read it easily on your Kindle, you can email the PDF to your personal Kindle email address with "Convert" as the subject. Before doing this, you'll need to find your Kindle email address and add your regular email address to its sender list.

steps.title: Hover over "Account & Lists" and select Content & Devices.
steps.content: Hover over "Account & Lists" and select Content & Devices . You'll see "Account & Lists" in the upper-right corner of Amazon once signed in.

steps.title: Click the Devices tab.
steps.content: Click the Devices tab. It's at the top of the Digital Content page.

steps.title: Select your Kindle.
steps.content: Select your Kindle. If you have more than one Kindle registered, select the one you want to use to read the PDF.

steps.title: Customize your email address.
steps.content: Customize your email address. By default, your Kindle's email address is long and filled with random letters. And unlike regular email addresses, these letters are case-sensitive. To change your Kindle address to something easier to use, click Edit , replace the part of the address before "@kindle.com" with something simpler, and click Save . Write down or copy the email address to a safe location.

steps.title: Click the Preferences tab.
steps.content: Click the Preferences tab. It's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Personal Document Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Personal Document Settings . It's the last option on the list.

steps.title: Add your email address to the "Approved" list.
steps.content: Add your email address to the "Approved" list. Scroll down to the "Approved Personal Document E-mail List" section. If you don't see your normal personal email address listed, click Add a new approved e-mail address to add it now. [2] X Research source Also, make sure you see "Archiving is Enabled" just above the email address list. If it's disabled, click Edit Archive Settings and enable it now. This ensures that when you send the PDF to your Kindle to convert it to MOBI, it'll be easy to find in your library.

steps.title: Send the PDF to your Kindle address from your personal email address.
steps.content: Send the PDF to your Kindle address from your personal email address. To make sure the PDF is converted to Kindle's MOBI format, you must type the word Convert into the email's subject line. To attach the PDF to the email message in most email apps, click the paperclip icon or the word Attach , and select the PDF. If you don't add "Convert" to the subject, you will still receive the PDF on your Kindle, and you'll be able to read it. However, it won't convert to the MOBI format. Make sure you're sending the document from an email address in the Approved list. Your personal Kindle email address will not accept files from any other addresses.

steps.title: Connect your Kindle to the internet to receive the PDF.
steps.content: Connect your Kindle to the internet to receive the PDF. The next time your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi, it will receive the PDF you sent, convert it to MOBI, and display it in your Kindle library.

steps.title: Install Auto Kindle eBook Converter for Windows.
steps.content: Install Auto Kindle eBook Converter for Windows. This tiny open-source Windows app can quickly convert PDF files to the MOBI format. You can get the app from https://sourceforge.net/projects/autokindle . Other than being able to choose the output location, this tool doesn't allow you to customize the MOBI file in any way. It's just a quick tool for simpler conversions, such as scanned documents and other files without special formatting. If you want more control over how the MOBI file appears, use the Calibre method.

steps.title: Open Auto Kindle eBook Converter.
steps.content: Open Auto Kindle eBook Converter . You'll find it in your Start menu inside a folder with the same name.

steps.title: Click the Select button.
steps.content: Click the Select button. It's near the top-right portion of the window under "Default Output Location."

steps.title: Select an output folder and click OK.
steps.content: Select an output folder and click OK . The folder you select will be where the MOBI file is saved after conversion.

steps.title: Click the Save button.
steps.content: Click the Save button. It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click the X to close the app.
steps.content: Click the X to close the app. Closing this window makes the file browser window appear.

steps.title: Select the PDF file you want to convert and click Open.
steps.content: Select the PDF file you want to convert and click Open . Auto Kindle eBook Converter will now convert the PDF to the MOBI format. The finished file will appear in the folder you selected as the Default Output Location.
